snippet: In seeking to airbrush Bo Xilai, the disgraced leader of Chongqing, out of public life, party officials in Beijing have dusted off a strategy perfected during the Cultural Revolution.
abstract: Chinese government seeks to expunge all traces of disgraced party official Bo Xilai from the public life of Chongqing by removing ads, portraits, videos and billboards connected to him, following a strategy perfected during the Cultural Revolution.

byline.contributor: Edy Yin contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: In seeking to airbrush Bo Xilai, the disgraced leader of Chongqing, out of public life, party officials in Beijing have dusted off a strategy perfected during the Cultural Revolution.

headline.seo: In Old Tradition, China Races to Erase Bo Xilai’s Legacy
headline.main: China, in Old Tradition, Races to Airbrush Fallen Leader Out of Public Life
headline.print_headline: China, in Old Tradition, Races to Airbrush Fallen Leader Out of Public Life
